DIGB-83028.Funzionalità: Promo Dynamic Recharge real bonus - Promo creation
DIGB-83028.Risultato Atteso: The promotion is successfully created by generating an identifying Promo ID.
DIGB-83028.Author: Battimo Giuseppe EXT

Steps.Step Description: the user accesses the NPPL portal: https://test-promo-manager-pokerstars.sisal.it/fe/#/promo
Steps.Expected Result: the user views the promotions list

Steps.Step Description: the user from the "PROMOTIONS" section clicks "on products"
Steps.Expected Result: the user views the list of product promotions

Steps.Step Description: the user clicks on the button: CREATE
Steps.Expected Result: the user opens the Create Promotion form

Steps.Step Description: ANAGRAFICA TABfill in name fill in description select calculation type: top-up select promo category: test select prize nature: Bonus select bonus type: Real bonus select deductibility: deductible select promotion type: single select prize accrual method: dynamic select prize payment method: manual "protocol required" flag: active
Steps.Expected Result: The "Next" CTA is activated

Steps.Step Description: user clicks on CTA : next
Steps.Expected Result: the user moves to the ELIGIBILITY tab

Steps.Step Description: ELIGIBILITY TAB select "Promo Eligibility Type": public
Steps.Expected Result: the "Next" CTA is activated

Steps.Step Description: user clicks on CTA : next
Steps.Expected Result: the user moves to the CONDITIONS tab

Steps.Step Description: CONDITIONS TAB select validity type: range insert date from/to select Membership method: promotional code fill in promotional code select Payment Channels: select all select Payment Methods: select all select Payment Channel Details: select all
Steps.Expected Result: the "Next" CTA is activated

Steps.Step Description: user clicks on CTA : next
Steps.Expected Result: the user moves to the CALCULATION PARAMETERS tab

Steps.Step Description: CALCULATION PARAMETERS TAB select bonus payment: instant select bonus amount type: fixed select bach type: single enter minimum top-up: €50 bonus amount: €10
Steps.Expected Result: the "Next" CTA is activated

Steps.Step Description: user clicks on CTA : next
Steps.Expected Result: the user moves to the EROGAZIONE tab

Steps.Step Description: EROGAZIONE TAB preview information flag: on Bonus distribution: single select template: casino select spendability channels: select all fill in bonus name select bonus expiry: within + number of days
Steps.Expected Result: the "Next" CTA is activated

Steps.Step Description: user clicks on CTA : next
Steps.Expected Result: the user moves to the INFORMATION tab

Steps.Step Description: INFORMATION TAB click on: generate information
Steps.Expected Result: inside the fields: "title" and "information" the information relating to the promo is generated

Steps.Step Description: user clicks on CTA : save
Steps.Expected Result: The promotion is successfully created by generating an identifying Promo ID.

[[RED]]TC_FIDO_GEN_001[[/RED]].Precondizioni: A PoS must exist in the system and be eligible for generalist product activation. Credit Policy and rating data must be available. SDD mandate process must be enabled for precaricato generalists.
[[RED]]TC_FIDO_GEN_001[[/RED]].Risultato Atteso: Fido is correctly assigned, modified, or reset for generalist PoS according to the business rules and Credit Policy.
[[RED]]TC_FIDO_GEN_001[[/RED]].Title: [[RED]]Fido Management for Generalist PoS: Assignment, Modification, and Reset Flow[[/RED]]
[[RED]]TC_FIDO_GEN_001[[/RED]].Dataset: PoS data, product type (GNTN/ONLINE), Cerved rating, SDD mandate status, Credit Policy table.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure a PoS (Point of Sale) is being activated with a generalist product (GNTN or ONLINE) on the GEO management system.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is eligible for fido assignment according to product type and policy.

Steps.Step Description: For a standard generalist, verify that the fido is assigned based on the product installed and the rating defined by Cerved, as per the Credit Policy table.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is assigned to the PoS according to the rating and product type.

Steps.Step Description: For a precaricato generalist, verify that upon contract activation and pending SDD mandate alignment, a default fido of 300 EUR is assigned without requiring Credit Management authorization.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS receives a default fido of 300 EUR and is flagged as precaricato.

Steps.Step Description: Upon SDD mandate alignment, verify that the precaricato generalist is converted to a standard generalist and fido is recalculated as per policy.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS status changes to standard generalist and fido is updated according to policy.

Steps.Step Description: Request a fido modification (increase or decrease) due to a change in rating, game volume, payment regularity, guarantees, or FV report.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is modified according to the new parameters and policy.

Steps.Step Description: For ONLINE PoS, simulate a block due to unpaid debts and verify that the fido is reset to zero upon notification from Credit Management to GEO.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is set to zero for the ONLINE PoS after the block is triggered.

Steps.Step Description: For GNTN PoS, simulate an unpaid debt and verify that the fido is not reduced, but the PoS is blocked from collecting GNTN.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido remains unchanged, but GNTN collection is inhibited for the PoS.

[[RED]]TC_FIDO_GEN_001[[/RED]].Funzionalità: Fido assignment, modification, and reset for generalist PoS

TC_DATA_COLLECTION_001.Precondizioni: All external systems are available and accessible. The 'ZENIT - Elenco Dati' file is available and up to date. User has access rights to initiate and monitor data collection.

RU_4.1.1_DATI_SAP_TC01.Precondizioni: The SAP system is operational and contains at least one configured Point of Sale (PoS) with data for Insoluti, Garanzie, Blocco al Sollecito, Crediti Aperti, and Hopper/Cambia monete. The integration interface for data extraction is active.
RU_4.1.1_DATI_SAP_TC01.Risultato Atteso: For each type of data change in SAP, the system transmits the required information fields as specified for Insoluti, Garanzie, Blocco al Sollecito, Crediti Aperti, and Hopper/Cambia monete flows.
RU_4.1.1_DATI_SAP_TC01.Title: Verify SAP Data Flows for PoS Information Updates
RU_4.1.1_DATI_SAP_TC01.Dataset: Test PoS records with varying data for each information flow (Insoluti, Garanzie, Blocco al Sollecito, Crediti Aperti, Hopper/Cambia monete).

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a change in the 'Insoluti' data for a Point of Sale (PoS) in the SAP system.
Steps.Expected Result: The system sends the following information: PoS Identifier (IdRice), Total Number of Insoluti, Number of Insoluti for the Current Year, Number of Insoluti for the last 6 months (Rolling), Number of Insoluti for the last 12 months (Rolling).

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a change in the 'Garanzie' data for a PoS in the SAP system.
Steps.Expected Result: The system sends the following information: PoS Identifier (IdRice), Guarantee Type (Accantonamenti a Piano, Fidejussioni, Depositi), Total Balance Amount per Guarantee Type, Guarantee Start Date (only for Fidejussioni), Guarantee Expiry Date (only for Fidejussioni).

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a change in the 'Blocco al Sollecito' status for a PoS in the SAP system.
Steps.Expected Result: The system sends the following information: PoS Identifier (IdRice), Blocco al Sollecito status. Only the most severe block for each customer is sent, based on the severity hierarchy (e.g., legal > warning > repayment plan). The data is updated whenever the status of an open item changes.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a change in the 'Crediti Aperti' data for a PoS in the SAP system.
Steps.Expected Result: The system sends the following information: PoS Identifier (IdRice), Total Balance Amount. The balances of open items for the specified accounts (COGE 158001, 150005, 150001 for SISAL SPA 3030; 152001, 158001 for SISAL ITALIA SPA 1012) are transmitted. Special attention is given to 'IAG' credits, which may remain open for a few hours after the IAG.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a change in the 'Hopper -- Cambia monete' data for a PoS in the SAP system.
Steps.Expected Result: The system sends the following information: PoS Identifier (IdRice), Hopper IAG End-of-Relationship Balance, Hopper IAG Recovery Balance, Coin Changer Balance.

RU_4.1.1_DATI_SAP_TC01.Funzionalità: Data extraction and transmission from SAP for PoS information updates.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to view data that should be restricted for the 'Consultatore' profile.
Steps.Expected Result: Restricted data is not visible or access is denied according to the profile's limitations.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to extract data from the consultation section.
Steps.Expected Result: Data extraction is either limited or denied according to the 'Consultatore' profile's permissions.

RU_4.2.3_PROFILE_CONSULTATORE.Funzionalità: Profile-based data access and extraction limitations

RU_4.2.4_OP_PROFILE_VIEW_LIMIT.Precondizioni: Operator user exists with a profile configured to have limited data consultation permissions. The system is accessible and operational.
RU_4.2.4_OP_PROFILE_VIEW_LIMIT.Risultato Atteso: Operator can consult data, but only within the limitations defined by the operator profile. Data outside the permitted scope is not visible.
RU_4.2.4_OP_PROFILE_VIEW_LIMIT.Title: Operator Profile: Data Consultation with View Limitations
RU_4.2.4_OP_PROFILE_VIEW_LIMIT.Dataset: Operator credentials with restricted profile permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the system as an operator user with restricted profile permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: Operator dashboard is displayed with access limited to permitted functionalities.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the data consultation section available to the operator profile.
Steps.Expected Result: Data consultation interface is displayed with visible data limited according to operator profile restrictions.

RU_4.2.4_OP_PROFILE_VIEW_LIMIT.Funzionalità: Operator profile data consultation with view limitations.

RU_4.2.5_SCHERMATA_ACCESSO_Ricerca.Precondizioni: User has valid credentials and access to the ZENIT application. The application is available and reachable. User is authorized to perform searches and access the 'Report' section.
RU_4.2.5_SCHERMATA_ACCESSO_Ricerca.Risultato Atteso: After login, all specified search fields are displayed, searches can be performed with any single field, all search types are available, and the 'Report' section is accessible from the Access (Ricerca) screen.
RU_4.2.5_SCHERMATA_ACCESSO_Ricerca.Title: Verify Search Fields Displayed After Login in ZENIT Access Screen
RU_4.2.5_SCHERMATA_ACCESSO_Ricerca.Dataset: Valid user credentials. No specific test data required for search fields as any single field can be used for search.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the Access (Ricerca) screen.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the search fields displayed on the Access (Ricerca) screen.
Steps.Expected Result: The following search fields are visible: ID RICE, ZONA RICE, VAT Number, Tax Code of Owner, Company Name, Trade Name (Sign), CLUSTER_PV, CHANNEL I, CHANNEL II, Municipality.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that it is possible to perform a search by filling in only one of the available fields and initiating the search.
Steps.Expected Result: The system returns results matching the entered field, which may include a single Point of Sale or multiple Points of Sale with the specified characteristics.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the search types available are: Single, Multiple, and Linked Points of Sale.
Steps.Expected Result: The search type options 'Single', 'Multiple', and 'Linked Points of Sale' are available for selection.

Steps.Step Description: Check for the presence of a navigation option to access the 'Report' section from the Access (Ricerca) screen.
Steps.Expected Result: A navigation option to the 'Report' section is present on the Access (Ricerca) screen.

RU_4.2.5_SCHERMATA_ACCESSO_Ricerca.Funzionalità: Search functionality and navigation on the ZENIT Access (Ricerca) screen.

RU_4.2.6_Single_Search_Result_Display.Precondizioni: User is authenticated and has access to the single search functionality. At least one record exists that will return a single result when searched.
RU_4.2.6_Single_Search_Result_Display.Risultato Atteso: All required fields are displayed in the single search result, and the option to extract the displayed data is present.
RU_4.2.6_Single_Search_Result_Display.Title: Verify single search result displays all required fields and allows data extraction
RU_4.2.6_Single_Search_Result_Display.Dataset: Valid search criteria that will return a single result (example: unique identifier).

Steps.Step Description: Perform a single search for a record using the search functionality.
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates to the single search result details screen.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the details displayed on the result screen.
Steps.Expected Result: The following fields are displayed: id rice, zona rice, denomination, location, channel I, channel II, total number of AWP, total number of VLT, average coin in, average BC rolling 12 months, average BC current year, guarantees present, AM, KA, Cerved scoring, number of unpaid rolling 12 months, number of unpaid current year, red list (Yes/No), credit (single row total with indication of number of accounting slips), reminder block (single row), credit limits set for PoS, credit limit consumption, available cash at point of sale.

Steps.Step Description: Check for the presence of a data extraction option on the result screen.
Steps.Expected Result: An option to extract the displayed data is available.

RU_4.2.6_Single_Search_Result_Display.Funzionalità: Display of all required fields and data extraction option in single search result.

RU_4.2.7_TC01.Precondizioni: User is logged in and has access to the report and management section. Application is in Phase 1, where only the 'Export to Excel' button should be present.
RU_4.2.7_TC01.Risultato Atteso: The 'Export to Excel' button is present and visible in the report and management section during Phase 1.
RU_4.2.7_TC01.Title: Verify presence of 'Export to Excel' button in report and management section (Phase 1)
RU_4.2.7_TC01.Dataset: No specific data required; access to the section is sufficient.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the report and management section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: The report and management section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Check for the presence of the 'Export to Excel' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Export to Excel' button is visible in the report and management section.

RU_4.2.8_MultiPoS_Search.Precondizioni: User is authenticated and has access to the search (access) screen. There are multiple PoS records in the system that match the search criteria, including closed PoS. Geographical search is not used.
RU_4.2.8_MultiPoS_Search.Risultato Atteso: The system displays all PoS matching the search criteria in a table with the total count, allows export to Excel, and enables selection of a single PoS for detailed view.
RU_4.2.8_MultiPoS_Search.Title: Verify multiple PoS results and Excel export after search from access screen
RU_4.2.8_MultiPoS_Search.Dataset: Valid user credentials; search criteria that return multiple PoS, including closed PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Access the application and navigate to the search (access) screen.
Steps.Expected Result: The search (access) screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search that is expected to return multiple PoS (Points of Sale) results.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of PoS matching the search criteria is displayed in a tabular format, including closed PoS, with the total number of PoS indicated. Geographical search is excluded.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the displayed table contains a minimum set of data for each PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Each PoS row in the table displays the required minimum data set.

Steps.Step Description: Click the option to export the displayed PoS data to an Excel file.
Steps.Expected Result: The data currently displayed in the table is exported and downloaded as an Excel file.

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific PoS from the list.
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates to the single PoS details (Riscontro Singolo) screen for the selected PoS.

RU_4.2.8_MultiPoS_Search.Funzionalità: Multiple PoS search results, tabular display, Excel export, and navigation to single PoS details.

TC-429-01.Precondizioni: At least one POS exists in the system with one or more linked POS based on the specified association fields. The tester has access to the backend interface and valid credentials to perform the request.
TC-429-01.Risultato Atteso: When requesting information for a POS, all related data is retrieved, any linked POS are displayed, the association field is indicated, and each linked POS is selectable.
TC-429-01.Title: Verify retrieval and display of linked POS information with association field indication
TC-429-01.Dataset: POS records with known associations based on the specified fields (no hardcoded values; use example data if needed for clarification).

Steps.Step Description: Request information for a specific POS using a unique identifier (e.g., POS ID or RICE ID) via the backend interface.
Steps.Expected Result: All data related to the requested POS is retrieved as specified in RU 4.2.6.

Steps.Step Description: Check the response for the presence of any linked POS based on the following fields: VAT number of POS, Tax code of POS, Holder's name, Holder's VAT number, Holder's tax code, Email, Company name, Denomination.
Steps.Expected Result: Any linked POS are listed in the response, and the specific field that generated the association is clearly indicated for each linked POS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each linked POS in the response can be selected for further operations (e.g., navigation or data retrieval).
Steps.Expected Result: Each linked POS is selectable in the interface or via the backend operation.

TC-429-01.Funzionalità: Linked POS retrieval and association field indication

RU_4.2.10_POS_Report_Excel_Button.Precondizioni: User has access to the ZENIT application and the POS reports section. The system is in Phase 1, where only the 'Export to Excel' button is available for reports.
RU_4.2.10_POS_Report_Excel_Button.Risultato Atteso: The 'Export to Excel' button is present in the POS reports section and allows immediate export of the report in Excel format.
RU_4.2.10_POS_Report_Excel_Button.Title: Verify presence and functionality of 'Export to Excel' button for POS reports in ZENIT (Phase 1)
RU_4.2.10_POS_Report_Excel_Button.Dataset: Valid user credentials with access to POS reports. Example POS report data available for export.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged into the ZENIT application.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the section where POS reports are available.
Steps.Expected Result: The POS reports section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the 'Export to Excel' button in the POS reports section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Export to Excel' button is visible in the POS reports section.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Export to Excel' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The POS report is immediately downloaded in Excel format.

4.3 STORICO DATI [FASE 1].Risultato Atteso: [[RED]]The user can view the data history records in the Data History section.[[/RED]]
4.3 STORICO DATI [FASE 1].Title: [[RED]]View Data History - Phase 1[[/RED]]

TC-ARCH-001.Precondizioni: System is live and configured for daily data archival. The 'ZENIT - elenco dati' file is available and correctly referenced by the system. Test PoS and product data are present in the system.
TC-ARCH-001.Risultato Atteso: The system archives a complete and accurate daily snapshot of all required data at 00:00, and allows future queries on historical data as specified.
TC-ARCH-001.Title: Verify daily archival of data with historical snapshots at 00:00
TC-ARCH-001.Dataset: Test PoS and product data as per 'ZENIT - elenco dati' file.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the system date and time is set to just before 00:00.
Steps.Expected Result: System is ready to perform daily archival at 00:00.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until the system time reaches 00:00.
Steps.Expected Result: System triggers the archival process for the previous day's data.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that a snapshot of all required data, as specified in the 'ZENIT - elenco dati' file, is archived for the previous day.
Steps.Expected Result: A complete and accurate snapshot of the previous day's data is archived according to the specified frequency.

Steps.Step Description: Query the archived data for a specific PoS and product for a given day.
Steps.Expected Result: The system returns the correct historical data for the selected PoS and product for the specified day.

TC-ARCH-001.Funzionalità: Daily data archival and historical snapshot creation.

TC-432-01.Precondizioni: User has access to Zenit with permissions to import POS data. The POS data file is prepared according to the required format.
TC-432-01.Risultato Atteso: The POS data file is successfully imported into Zenit, and the data is available for further management or modification.
TC-432-01.Title: Import POS Data File for Offline POS Archiving in Zenit
TC-432-01.Dataset: POS data file with required fields (example data can be provided if needed).

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a data file containing POS information with the required fields: ID RICE, ZONA RICE, DENOMINAZIONE, RAGIONE SOCIALE, INDIRIZZO, COMUNE, P.IVA, COD. FISCALE, IMPORTO CREDITO, STATUS, PASSAGGIO A PERDITA.
Steps.Expected Result: A data file with the specified fields is available for import.

Steps.Step Description: Access the Zenit application as a user with permissions to import POS data.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit application dashboard is displayed and user is authenticated.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the POS data import section in Zenit.
Steps.Expected Result: POS data import interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the prepared POS data file through the import interface.
Steps.Expected Result: The file is successfully uploaded and recognized by the system.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the import process for the uploaded file.
Steps.Expected Result: The system processes the file and imports the POS data. A confirmation message is displayed indicating successful import.

TC-432-01.Funzionalità: POS data import and archiving for offline POS.
